title: The Profits of Religion
creator: Upton Sinclair
description: LibriVox recording of The Profits of Religion by Upton Sinclair. Read by Michelle Harris. The Profits of Religion: An Essay in Economic Interpretation is a non-fiction book, first published in 1917, by the American novelist and muckraking journalist Upton Sinclair. It is a snapshot of the religious movements in the U.S. before its entry into World War I. In this book, Sinclair attacks institutionalized religion as a "source of income to parasites, and the natural ally of every form of oppression and exploitation." (Summary from Wikipedia) For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording. For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org. M4B format available
subject: christianity; religion; audiobook; librivox
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text

reviews.reviewbody:
This is a great reading of a most pertinent book - as pertinent now as it was when it was written.  Thanks to Michelle Harris for this gift, and I've listened to it twice so far.

The reading is clear and concise; there's no doubt about what is being read.  A most pleasant voice to go along with a most important book.  Thank you for your efforts!  Five stars all the way.
